column5: Got out for a couple of hours this morning.  Tried to fish for an hour for stupid lake trout and whitefish but they would not cooperate, as usual.  I got frustrated and decided to go for some smallmouth. We caught lots of good size perch (dinner) and a bunch of small smallies (which is a good sign) but only one nice one.  I managed to coax a 3.4 pounder to hit my crankbait.  Got home and it was still fairly early in the morning.  A fun start to Canada day! Lots of nice perch out there  loads of these little bass which tells me that the resident population seems healthy.  These little guys will hit lures about the same size as them.   This is a nice 3.4 pound Simcoe smallie. Not a huge fish but a nice one.
boy!  are you sure you're not holding those first two fish closer to the camera to make them look so big?  jj! simcoe smallies are always such nice photo fish... cool angle on that 3.4
Beauty report Cudz  It's always fun to catch them bass when the other species is giving you the round around.... Nice 3.4Lbser Thanks for sharing Leechman
Sure beats sitting at home.. Nice smallie.
cudz, try off the oro lines, there were tons of trout there all winter long from what i hear the lakers and whities are slowing down anyways tambo
